alert.note: Alert for Bath; Montgomery (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 27 at 8:11PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Montgomery and western Bath Counties through 845 PM EDT... At 811 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Bethel, or 7 miles northwest of Owingsville, moving southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Reynoldsville and Odessa around 820 PM EDT. Flat Creek around 825 PM EDT. Owingsville, Craigs and Slate Valley around 835 PM EDT. Bourbon Furnace, Kendall Springs, Peasticks, Stepstone and Howards Mill around 840 PM EDT. Marshall, Preston and Polksville around 845 PM EDT. THIS INCLUDES Interstate 64 in eastern Kentucky between mile markers 115 and 126. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
